sentences.sContent: This led him to calculate that the information content of any event was proportional to the logarithm of its inverse probability of occurrence.
sentences.sContent_eng: This led him to calculate that the information content of any event was proportional to the logarithm of its inverse probability of occurrence.
sentences.sCn: 这使他提出了这样的推论：事件的信息容量与事件发生逆概率的对数成正比。

sentences.sContent: This plots the logarithm to base 10 of the values on the axis.
sentences.sContent_eng: This plots the logarithm to base 10 of the values on the axis.
sentences.sCn: 此命令在轴上绘制以 10 为底的值的对数。

sentences.sContent: A logarithm tells you what power a base number must be raised to in order to produce a given value.
sentences.sContent_eng: A logarithm tells you what power a base number must be raised to in order to produce a given value.
sentences.sCn: 对数说明一个底数的几次幂等于一个给定的值。

trans.tranOther: a number representing another number in a mathematical system so that complicated calculations can be done as simple addition
